description.narrative: 1. Wider Impact: With a wide presence in India, Axis Bank has a natural advantage in terms of client reach which will allow it to expand rapidly in this area with IFC''s support. Through the proposed facility, Axis Bank can support a wider range of clients in the renewable energy and climate change space. 2. Demonstration Effect: Axis Bank''s expansion in this space is likely to help attract other financial institutions to increase their risk appetite and invest more actively in Climate Change sectors. 3. Greenhouse Gases (GHGs) savings: The proposed investment will result in substantial savings of GHG emissions as it will encourage investment in clean energy projects. 4. Institution Building: IFC''s support to Axis Bank will help it to scale up its capacity to assess clean energy projects through sharing of its experience and knowledge of the sector worldwide.

Axis Bank (the Bank) is amongst Indias largest private sector banks with a network of 1,390 branches & extension counters, and 6,270 ATMs as of 31st March 2011. The Bank has a loan portfolio of $31.97 billion and a deposit base of $ 42.49 billion as of 31st March 2011. The proposed investment involves a long term US dollar loan on IFCs own account and mobilization by IFC of parallel loans from international investors to the Singapore branch of Axis Bank. The proceeds of the IFC loan will be utilized by the Bank to on-lend to Indian companies as external commercial borrowings for projects relating to climate change projects. Such projects would include projects related to renewable energy, energy efficiency improvement, water management and related areas.
